Sentencas: Recent studies indicate that the electrolyte ionic conductivity in an SOFC can be considerably increased by using lithium compounds as the electrode.
Titulo: Mechanism for Major Improvement in SOFC Electrolyte Conductivity When Using Lithium Compounds as Anode

Sentencas: We found that the ionic conductivity of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 electrolyte in the Ni0.8Co0.15Al0.05LiO2 anode cell was 10.1 mS/cm only at 550 degrees C without H-2, but it increased to 44.6 mS/cm after feeding H-2 to the anode.
Titulo: Mechanism for Major Improvement in SOFC Electrolyte Conductivity When Using Lithium Compounds as Anode

Sentencas: It was found that LiOH/Li2CO3 moved into the GDC electrolyte from the NCAL anode and formed a three-phase composite electrolyte.
Titulo: Mechanism for Major Improvement in SOFC Electrolyte Conductivity When Using Lithium Compounds as Anode

Sentencas: A space charge region with a high oxygen vacancy concentration is formed around the interface of LiOH/Li2CO3 and GDC, which increases the ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Mechanism for Major Improvement in SOFC Electrolyte Conductivity When Using Lithium Compounds as Anode
